comment: Clear and easy
Not an app I use often, but when I do need it it's really great to have. Much cleaner and more efficient than keeping score on a pad of paper.

title: AWESOME
comment: Easy to use and really nice. Good Job !

title: Broke on the Galaxy S5
comment: Does not work on the Galaxy S5.  Can't make any option changes or even set a (rematch) when the game is over.  It would be great to be able to set a finishing score for games like cribbage.

title: Very good
comment: Could think of any possible improvement.

title: Flawless
comment: Perfect for any game.

title: Great scoring app
comment: I've used this for years with no issues. .. until now.  Recently started using a Galaxy Tab S, and the "options" option does not show up during the game.  There is no way to undo a score,  and I make a lot of mistakes. Lol
The best

title: You had one job
comment: I switched to another app during a game and switched back to see that all scores were reset to zero.
FOSS and 0 permissions :)

title: Force closes almost every...
comment: ...game played. It seems happen at higher scores. Both a 2012 Nexus 7 and Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5 are affected.

title: Force closes a lot
comment: I love the way the app works but on a regular basis it force closes during s game and loses the score which is obviously just about the worst thing a score keeping app can do.
Simplicity! nuff said :)

title: Can't figure it out...no directions
comment: I can't figure out how to edit or add players after I've created the game...I also don't like that it doesn't sort them ..highest points to lowest..

title: No better scorekeeping app!
comment: Updating my previous review from 2 to 4 stars. The dev reached out to me and let me know that when leaving the app, the games are saved in the list of saved games, so the scores preserve. Only complaints are the menu overflow button appearing on Nexus devices but that's not a big deal. Seriously is a very useful app.
The game was saved; it just started a new game on your behalf. If you go back through the list of games, it should be there. Sorry, though; I admit it's confusing. :)
Maybe I'm just daft but I can see where I can put in the name of the game played.
Long-press on the game in the list of saved games, then choose "Enter Name." :)

title: Well made
comment: A great visual aid to describe exactly where you went wrong during a game. It keeps a detailed record of games past for reminiscence.

title: Universal and helpful
comment: Simple to use, yet powerful enough to help you with most of your games. Open source. What else to ask for.
Great app for cards

title: Amazing app
comment: This app does exactly what it says it does and more. The only feature that I felt was missing is having preset customizations for different games so you don't have to go into the settings as often.

title: Great app, needs work
comment: The app is great except for entering large numbers, you have to click on too many things. Change it so that a click on the players score opens the entry box with an active cursor. This would make the app so much better. It would also be great to be able to insert the game's name. Otherwise I love the features and it is very easy to use.

title: The best ever!
comment: I have tried several apps like this and none would be as good and functional as KeepScore. The app is fantastic... It has a great (and customizable) interface, it's extremely simple to use and here's what I liked most: You have lots of settings to play around with, such as defining how much score each button will increase or decrase.

title: Awesome score keeper
comment: Quick and efficient entry.
Fantastic app, best if its kind on the market

title: Needs improvement
comment: Used to work great, now it crashes on my Nexus 5. Very sad to lose the score mid-game :-(

title: Great for game time
comment: Only trouble is that we pay pass the pigs and 0 is a score. We want to be able to track when it was someone's turn and they scored zero. Will you allow that Mr. Dev? Thanks !
You can add zero - just long press on the history and choose "add zero." :)

title: Great
comment: It's great for my pokemon battles

title: Excellent scorekeeping app!
comment: If you like to play board games, but keeping score with pen and paper is soooo 20th century, then this is the app for you. Customizable default point amounts are a plus. Highly recommend this app!

title: I love this app
comment: Ever since I installed it the first time I have loved it! Only down side is the phones themselves... Always need to play near a power outlet because my phone is never charged at the right time LOL
Great!

title: Great app, but unstable
comment: I pull this out for Star Realms and it's just the best way to keep track of authority instead of using those dinky cards. The only issue (which is a big one) is that the app randomly crashes multiple times per game. Would rate 5 if the issue were fixed.

title: Perfect
comment: I just downloaded this and I love it. Has every option I wanted like keeping track of scores for more than one game with different number of players, adding points by +/-10, 5,1 and even able to customize those buttons. I'm sure there are going to be more surprises for me to find too.

title: Great features but sadly unstable.
comment: It's perfect right up until it crashes and loses your scores mid game.

title: Ottima e versatile
comment: Cercavo un app segnapunti per la briscola a 5, questa fa proprio al mio caso! Tutti i tasti sono personalizzabili e tiene il conteggio del totale dei punti assegnati a manche! che dire FAVOLOSA!

title: Just perfect
comment: Just what I was looking for!!! Cant even think of any features it really needs. It has EVERYTHING. Superb app any family game player needs

title: Scrabble game score keep
comment: I use it to track Scrabble game scores!
Great help

title: Great app!
comment: Just what i need.. now i don't have to look for paper and pen everytime i play capsa with my friends..

title: Great app.
comment: Just played a game with 11 people. Would love to have a quick button like history to show a full leader board. Maybe thing to add photos to people to see who is who.

title: Perfect
comment: It does everything it needs to. Nice and clean interface. No ads. No limitations. I love it.

title: Perfect for table games!
comment: Honestly, this is a must have.

title: Works great
comment: Does everything I want it to do. Plus other things I didn't know I wanted.

title: Just what I was looking for to track family games
comment: This app was perfect for my needs.  Needed something that I could easily keep score in various games and customize  the values so that it was quick and easy to use and get rid of paper & pen.  This app did that, and it had what it needed to do it well.  Things like keeping the screen on, and also being smart enough that if I hit +500 +100 +100 that I was saying +700 for that person for a turn.  Works perfectly.  Now my only 3 things I would love to see to make this app even better.  1.) When exporting to PDF find a way to export all that same information that you can see in the game history like in the app.  Then you can make nice tables/graphs in excel with the data and see the nice time/score layouts.  2.) The 4 on screen buttons are by far the most important for me playing games with high point values.  I was able to work with just 4 but it would be nice if you could customize to add a few more if desired.  3.) I have not made a mistake YET but I know I will especially with drinking games.  If I hit +500 points to somebody and meant to hit +100 I wish there was either an "undo" button or there was a "inverse" button.  Meaning do the opposite of a buttons value to fix mistakes.
Great app. I'm an avid board gamer and have found this more useful than the score keeping methods in the games I play.

title: Great for impromptu games out
comment: Great for any game score keeping. Excellent design.

title: Just one suggestion...
comment: My husband wants to boast when he beats me (because it happens so rarely). SO...Ability to upload score to social media. Other than that PERFECTION! Will buy the donate\full version!

title: The best scoring out there.
comment: I'm an avid board gamer and been largely missing this. With the amount of extra features, I can't believe this is a free app. Kudos to the author.

title: A Great App by a Great Guy
comment: Nolan built keepscore in part to help track our 24 minute long Dominion games. I recently used it to track a 5 team game of disc golf.  It/he is basically the best.

title: Does exactly what it should.
comment: One of my goto apps. New calculator feature has issues. Love the history feature

title: Great App
comment: This app always comes out during board game night.

title: Great but...
comment: The "onscreen buttons" should be visible on phones, maybe just resized. As it is the "onscreen buttons" are not visible on phones when you have more than 2 players.

title: Broken buttons.
comment: Up until the beginning of this month I loved this app and used it all the time with my family.  The additional buttons when you long press the +/- buttons have now stopped working correctly though.  Please fix it or I will have to find another app for this use
Sorry about that! Josh should have fixed it with the 1.5.1 release.

title: Worth it!
comment: Awesome for any game requiring a score to keep. Could use an added "tournament mode" but perfect otherwise.

title: This app is so simple, yet so GOOD!
comment: Can keep several games saved. Can play up to 30 players! - can't think of a single game where that would be needed, but a VERY EFFICIENT, SIMPLE, app. Fantastic!!!

title: Great App
comment: I use this app while playing straight pool and its simply awesome and easy to use.

title: Simple yet robust.
comment: I use this app to keep score playing straight pool, but it will work for anything. I looked through a dozen or so score keeping apps before I found this. It seemed obvious that there should be a generic app that isn't specific to a particular game or sport. Add and subtract points. Screen stays awake. It's fantastic.

title: Great
comment: Does exactly what you need it to do.

title: Perfect open source software
comment: I want to make some minor UI improvements like larger buttons and maybe an on screen timer. I'm considering downloading the source and working on it myself as a great beginning intro to android dev. Great work!

title: Works great.
comment: Easy to use.

title: Best!
comment: Excellent app without being overloaded with useless gimmicks. Simple, intuitive, clean interface, what else to ask for? Congratulations to the developer!

title: does exactly what I need
comment: Easy, simple, yet powerful. I couldn't ask for more.

title: Elegant scorekeeper
comment: I've been using this app for over a year, and it's so simple and versatile.

title: Brilliant
comment: I am overseas on an extended family holiday and finding pen and paper to keep score is not always easy. I thought there must be an app for that and found this one. So glad I did.

title: Love it
comment: Rock solid, does what it says.

title: Wonderful
comment: I use this app usually when I playing with friends

title: For more than just games. . .
comment: I use this to give participation points while teaching. All of the features make this app perfect for this function--I have data (in a spreadsheet) to show my principal, it is so easy to use my kids barely notice it, and I can easily copy names for the next day ("rematch" feature). Haven't run into any bugs yet either. :)

title: My favorite scoring app.
comment: Test drove a number of apps, specifically for Strut!. This is my favorite by far. My only wish list item would be to have the option to name the game played.
Actually, you can name a game by long-pressing it, then choosing "enter game name."  It's kind of a hidden feature!  :)

title: Nice work
comment: Could you add the ability to use a single player? Useful when there are two players and they need only the difference between themself. Thank you. Great program. 5 stars

title: GOOD
comment: TO  YOU NEED  TO  GO  PRO  TO GET MORE  THAN  EIGHT  PLAYERS?
Great app for every board or card game

title: So Good
comment: This app does exactly what I wanted it to do...keep score. No more searching for scrap paper for me!
Quick easy, keeps history.

title: I wish i could give it 100 stars
comment: Just the app i wanted !!

title: Great way to keep scores
comment: Used every time we play games.

title: Hell! It stopped working on Nook! At all!
comment: This moved from TOTALLY COOL to nothing. Come on, what is the purpose of keeping score on a non e-ink device? It drains battery life as a bit**, to keep the screen lit all the time. This on e-ink is total awesomeness. But it stopped working on Nook simple touch with latest update! I just fire it up, bang! closed. Please fix!

I have a rooted Nook Simple Touch myself. Neat little device!

Anyway, version 1.2.6 should solve your issue. If not, please re-open it on GitHub: https://github.com/nolanlawson/KeepScore/issues/64.

FYI, you can always find past releases of my apps at http://nolanlawson.com/apps. Just in case I mess up and you need to downgrade!  Thanks.

title: Useful app
comment: I have been looking for an app that keeps score and also keeps a history of past games.  This app is easy to use and mostly satisfies my requirements.  One thing I would find useful is showing the latest scores in the Saved Games summary page.  That is probably more useful to know than the number of rounds in that game, which is what shows right now.

title: Cool app
comment: Works nicely, has a nice setup,and has game options.

title: Great app
comment: Does exactly as advertised

title: Mst hain
comment: Mst hain

title: Best!
comment: Love this. One thing I would like added would be a widget.
Excellent App! Just what I was looking for!

title: Portrait mode
comment: By far the best scoring app but let down badly by forcing me to use landscape mode. I have rotation disabled for a reason- I expect it to be honoured.

title: coefficient
comment: Hi, I think this is the best score keeper i have tested (>20). The one thing i am missing here is the coefficient for the user. I am participating in the 3d archery tournaments and we have coefficients here. Lets say i am (man) shooting with longbow so my coefficient should by multiply by 1.18, my wife also longbow, so shes coefficient 1.41 because of woman. My friend shooting with olympic bow, his coefficient - 1, some compound bows - 0.72 or something. Is it available to request you to add coefficient functionality to this app? Thanks a lot for great app!
Supercool!
Fuuuun
All feature I would expect.

title: Best scoring app I've found
comment: Works for everything I've needed it for so far. Portrait mode would be nice though. As would allowing for more than 8 player (maybe in a scrollable list) and having access to the sort by score button on the main screen instead of the edit players area. But all in all, great app!

title: Great app
comment: Use it for Volleyball

title: Need timed scoring
comment: Awesome app, especially the graph part. :)  I think that in games like Carcasonne or Kingsburg (or even 5-player Spades with a rotating dealer), when the score is not entered in turns but gradually throughout the game, the graph fails cause it only takes scores in 'turns'. Would be nice to have a time-based graph for such games.

title: Frank
comment: Great app to keep score. We use it to keep track of a card game called moonshot euchre. But what would make this app great is if it could keep track of the dealer also. Thanks

title: Works great!
comment: I love this app! We customize it to fit the different games we play and it's so easy!

title: Best of its kind
comment: My wishes are: Option for automatic reorder by score.  Option to add thumbnails next to player names.  Option for zany sound effects for little kids.  Allow more than 8 players.   I want to use this app in my classroom.  I'll pay decently if you can build me this.    This app is the best in its league.  I've tried a dozen others and this is the closest to what I want.

title: just amazing
comment: it has the possibility of keep the score for almost any game that I know...

title: Easy to use, does what it says very well.
comment: This app is great. It's simple to use, has enough options to tailor scoring to your needs and great it saves results. Been using the app for well over a year now after trying a few. Well done.

title: Great but
comment: Unable to subtract a score. Otherwise really great!

title: Does what it says

title: Score

comment: This app is simple to use, full of features, and it looks great.

title: What i needed
comment: I needed an app thatwould score three player mahjong and keep a large over all score in big numbers but also show the score history and an over all total to be sure the scorewas ballanced. The time delay for adding the current score to the history was a great idea. And no ugly adds

title: Easy to use

title: Cool
comment: This is a cool little app. The only change I would make is being able to tell it the round is over. Need to take into account for children miscounting. :-\

comment: When entering a score bigger than 99, the last digit jumps on the next line. Other than that, very nice app.

title: Does what it says
comment: This app is great for keeping scores in games and tracking counts of things. Very useful for D&D, board less cribbage, and survey data collection!

title: Great scoring app!
comment: Love the flexibility in scoring options and looking forward to new versions with even more customizations.

title: Well done
comment: Best scoring app I've found.  Really excellent.

title: Great App, Love it! iPad version?
comment: I love this app! I use it all the time. I'm hoping you create an iPad version too. The alternatives in the Apple Store all suck!!!

title: Great app. Would pay money
comment: I just wish it supported more than 8 players. But in that situation you can just use 2 devices. Must have for game nights.

title: great, and hopefully improves further
comment: Works great, but I wish you could manually mark the end of rounds -- it doesn't keep track of rounds very well for some reason (I'm using it for Farkle). Still, it's the best Farkle scoring app I've found!

title: Better than paper
comment: I like that it saves scores and the graphs are cool too!

comment: Wonderful app but be careful if you want to multitask or turn off your phone, there is apparently a risk that all the scores will reset.  5 stars other than that.

title: Great
comment: It works great, but the number of players are low. I think it should be around 20. I727

title: EXCELLENT
comment: Very customizable. If someome scores a massive unusual number, you can enter it as a custom number. Even adds a line graph chart so you can track eveyone's progress over time.

title: Ics style please
comment: Please update so that the buttons look like ics style on ics.

title: Useful
comment: Very nice - another request for "game name" feature.

title: Good but not perfect
comment: Pretty good and simple app. I would very much like the possibility of having the name of the game before the name of the players so you know what score was related to what. Basically a simple way to keep track of who won at what game would make this app perfect.

title: Awesome
comment: Thanks what a great app, needed a cribbage board whilst on holiday and this has done the job perfectly. Have to say my friend was disappointed not to find it on his iPhone.

title: Awesome!
comment: Great features so far! Keep up the development! A per game history would be awesome!

title: Excellent
comment: Great for dominoes!

title: Love the app
comment: It's nearly perfect. It's a really handy tool for keeping score, but I wish it handled large numbers better (the text size doesn't shrink so numbers over 10000 get cut off).   Definitely a handy score keeping tool that's worth having on your phone for game night!

title: Awesome...just 2 things
comment: I love this app...if I was able to put a title for the game I play, that would be awesome.  I can see the names and score, I just play different games with this app. It would be fun to look back and easily remember what game I played and what the score was.    The second thing is perhaps a place to manually place a new score in after you've gone a couple of rounds...like, if I realized I need to edit a score from round 2, but we are already on round 4, I can't easily go back and change that with the current app.  Thanks for the app...it's great.
Very good

comment: Plus

comment: For those who play 45s this is perfect for keeping score. Just wish u could count by 5s with more than 2 ppl.

title: Useful
comment: The only thing I would add is the ability to set the point value for a win.  For example cribbage games are to 121.  Pitch, spades, and hearts all have different win values based on house rules.  This feature is all that is  needed to earn a fifth star.

title: Excellent
comment: Multiple tally counter all on one screen and you can enter names, perfect.

title: Great job

title: works very well

comment: Just what I needed - and shows round history. No ads, no weird permissions.

title: Simple and effective
comment: Does what it says on the tin and does it well. However, the ability to create multiple button value sets and switch between them (for scoring different games) would be worth fifth star!
Great app

title: Professional Design
comment: Great app! Does exactly what I want. The UI is simple and well designed. One feature that it could benefit from would be the ability to show the average score for specific or all players.

title: Nice score app - suggestions
comment: Like the base functions.  Thanks for landscape on tablet.  Suggest a way to keep bid, tricks and round totals all separate with a summary screen.  We play Oh Hell so would help.  Also would love to be able to update from history screen as tablet has plenty of real estate to spare.  Maybe even add a few user configurable score modifiers to make more flexible for many uses.
I tried 4 different scorecard apps before this one, and this one easily beats everyone else, its even better than i expected, its perfect

comment: I used this app to keep track of the cookie flavors being sold at our Girl Scout cookie booth! Every time we use tally marks on paper the count got messed up. Using this app worked great!  I loved that it was able to "keep score" for eight different kinds - all the other apps I found only went up to four players.

Keepscore
By far the best score keeping tool on the market. The only thing I think I would change would be adding support for eight players instead of six.
Great little app! Very easy to use. Open source! Wish it supported up to eight players.
So intuitive my 6 year old son didn't have to ask me how to use it! And I like it keeps the screen awake.
Would love a match score feature (3 games to 2).
Great app it would b great if ur next app was a free cheat database but whatever it is it would b awesome
